entry.title: Celtic post-title form warning to Rangers over change

entry.title: Scottish transfers: Rangers target confirms summer move, Celtic signing claim, Aberdeen coup hint
entry.summary: Following an action-packed evening in the Scottish Premiership, there is just one round of fixtures remaining with the campaign coming to a close on Sunday. After that, focus will surround the Scottish Cup final, pre-season and plans for next season.

entry.title: Scottish Premiership attendance record to be broken as Neil Doncaster hails 'hugely encouraging' figures
entry.summary: A new attendance record will be set for the Scottish Premiership on Wednesday night with crowd figures hitting the highest ever mark for a top flight season since the inception of the SPFL nearly a decade ago.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou irked by Celtic scrutiny talk as boss turns deaf ear with 'doesn't penetrate' retort
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou has shot down any notion that his Celtic side are open to scrutiny following a run of just one win in four Premiership matches either side of being declared champions.

entry.title: Matt O'Riley in Celtic admission on the mindset 'everyone should have'
entry.summary: The midfielder and his team-mates have two Premiership matches left before the Scottish Cup final.

entry.title: Wild Wednesday: Forget Hearts-Aberdeen Euro battle or Rangers farewells, the Mecca of Madness takes centre stage once more
entry.summary: The City of Discovery. Famous for its jute, jam and journalism. The home of the V&A and the Beano. Experts in construction of whaling ships which earned Dundee its aforementioned moniker. Cultural touchstones and institutions which are rightly celebrated but no longer should they act as the city's biggest attractions. They have to take a backseat. A backseat to the Mecca of Madness that continues to unfold on Tannadice Street and the two clubs separated by a couple of hundred metres.

entry.title: What channel is Hibs v Celtic on? Kick-off time, team, referee and VAR news
entry.summary: With just two cinch Premiership matches to play before Celtic turn their attention to the Scottish Cup final and the last remaining piece of the treble jigsaw, Ange Postecoglou’s champions travel to Easter Road on Wednesday night.

entry.title: What SFA chief Ian Maxwell said on VAR, Conference League, Scottish Cup final kick-off time switch
entry.summary: Scottish FA chief executive Ian Maxwell, speaking ahead of the organisation’s Week of Football initiative as part of the 150th anniversary celebrations, has addressed three controversial topics within Scottish football: Moving the kick-off time of the Scottish Cup, VAR and the proposed introduction of the Conference League.

entry.title: Scottish transfers: Rangers star in talks with EPL trio, bid for £13m-rated Celtic target. Hearts midfielder exits
entry.summary: There is less than a week left of the Scottish Premiership season with two rounds of fixtures over the next six days with the European and relegation places still to be decided. Meanwhile clubs are well into plans for next season regarding arrivals and departures.

entry.title: St Mirren reveal Celtic player who was deliberately targeted in 2-2 draw - 'it's not something you would ignore'
entry.summary: Curtis Main has revealed that St Mirren deliberately targeted Tomoki Iwata ahead of their 2-2 draw with Celtic.

entry.title: Kyogo Furuhashi eyes permanent place on Celtic Park walls as striker spared from St Mirren criticism
entry.summary: Given the almost childlike enthusiasm with which he energetically celebrates every victory, it should probably not come as a huge surprise to see Kyogo Furuhashi continue to whizz around the park in these end-of-season dead rubber contests as if his life depended on it.

entry.title: Fran Alonso: Forget title, Celtic changed Scottish women's football
entry.summary: Fran Alonso has told his players that they have changed the landscape of Scottish women’s football despite failing to land a first SWPL title this season.There was heartbreak for Celtic after they came within two minutes of winning their inaugural league with an emotional Alonso left to console his visibly distraught players in the aftermath of an afternoon when they were so near yet so far.

entry.title: Celtic, Rangers and Glasgow City serve up 'movie' climax as SWPL trophy arrives at Parkhead only to depart for Ibrox
entry.summary: Fran Alonso’s Miami Vice look was back at Celtic Park yesterday afternoon. By the time this game was over, however, the look was spoiled by the need for a sick bag.

entry.title: Celtic and Rangers dejection as Glasgow City clinch SWPL title after stoppage time drama at Ibrox
entry.summary: Glasgow City have emerged as champions with Rangers and Celtic left dejected after a thrilling climax to the Scottish Women's Premier League season.

entry.title: Glasgow City win the SWPL title as Celtic and Rangers fall short
entry.summary: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.

entry.title: Rangers, Celtic & Glasgow City go for title LIVE: SWPL Helicopter Sunday
entry.summary: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.

entry.title: What channel is Rangers v Glasgow City? What channel is Celtic Women v Hearts? TV details for SWPL title deciders
entry.summary: One of Celtic, Rangers or Glasgow City will be crowned Scottish Women's Premier League champions on Sunday as an epic three-way battle for the title reaches a dramatic conclusion.
